conclusion: To understand how the shadows A, B, C, and D will change when the light source moves to the back left or right, we need to consider the following factors:

Light Source Position: The direction of the light source affects the direction and length of the shadows. Moving the light source to the back left or right changes the angle of light hitting the objects.
Shadow Position: When the light source moves to the back left or right, the shadows will shift in the opposite direction.
Shadows will move towards the front right if the light source moves to the back left.
Shadows will move towards the front left if the light source moves to the back right.
Shadow Size: The size of the shadow depends on the angle of the light. When the light source moves further away (back left or right), the shadows will generally become longer and more stretched out.
The shadows are cast forward, indicating the light source is behind the objects.
